intro: Trichinium schwartzii, commonly known as the Schwaetz's trichinium, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
